title: Simulation-Based Civic Competency Enhancement Education Design for Online Violence Prevention

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level specialized knowledge and problem-solving skills, basic digital citizenship concepts, and experience in online community participation
context.additional_context: A blended learning environment using real-time video conferencing and LMS. Role-playing, simulations, and project-based assessments to emphasize practical competencies. Focus on nurturing digital citizenship and improving social relationships.

learning_goals: Learners explain three or more strategies for identifying online violence (e.g., verbal abuse pattern recognition, digital citizenship principles, legal rights verification)

Learners apply the 5-step bystander intervention model (notice-interpret-responsibility-ability-action) with 80% accuracy through simulation-based training and recognize social responsibilities as digital citizens

Learners design one online violence prevention campaign project (3â€“5 members) including target analysis, cultural context consideration, content planning, and implementation strategies, create a 10-minute presentation, and achieve B+ (80+ points) in at least two of three evaluation criteria (creativity, feasibility, effectiveness)

resources: Interactive simulation authoring tools (e.g., Articulate Storyline)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
